snippet.title: Former Pandora boss Jane Huxley is Spotify's new Australian MD
snippet.content:
Spotify has an new Australian managing director, with Jane Huxley, the former boss of vanquished rival Pandora talking on the role.
AdNews reports she replaces the streaming service's inaugural local MD, Kate Vale, who left in May.
Huxley launched Pandora in Australia in 2012, having previously been CEO and publisher of Fairfax Digital, and an executive at Microsoft and Vodafone.
She left Pandora in March after five years, before the business subsequently announced it would close its Australian in June. Pandora founder Tim Westergreen subsequently stepped down as CEO
Spotify in Australia it has around 2 million users. A hallmark of Huxley's time at Pandora was the commercial contracts, including the Woolworths in-store radio service.
Business Insider has contacted Spotify for comment.
